Legacy Document

Important: The information in this document is obsolete and should not be used for new development.

Inside Macintosh:

OpenDoc Class Reference

For the Mac OS

The OpenDoc Class Reference for the Mac OS provides complete reference documentation for OpenDoc on the Mac OS platform. It describes the platform-independent and Mac OS-specific classes, methods, types, constants, and error codes (exceptions) defined by OpenDoc.

This book is a companion to the OpenDoc Programmer\xBCs Guide for the Mac OS, which provides an architectural overview, synthesizes design concepts, and gives specific programming recommendations to illuminate the information in this book.

This book does not provide code samples. For detailed tutorial instructions and code listings taken from functioning Mac OS part editors, see the OpenDoc Cookbook for the Mac OS.

  • Part 1 of this book describes the public OpenDoc classes and methods.
  • Part 2 describes the OpenDoc types and constants, grouped by topic.
  • The appendix describes requirements for runtime installation of a shell plug-in on the Mac OS platform.
Availability: Click below to receive a copy of the OpenDoc Class Reference in any of the following formats.
